timeline.message: FINERACT-1102: Swagger Codegen Client JAR should be available on a Maven repo

timeline.bodyText: Let's simply omit this entire POM section entirely - remove?
timeline.author: vorburger

replies.bodyText:
As far as I'm aware you have to provide a POM... otherwise it won't work on Maven Central... unless you meant something different?
We could reduce the information though and just have name, license, Git repo URL.
replies.author: vidakovic

replies.bodyText: Yeah sorry I was responding to your TODO, and meant specifically and only not listing developers at all, but keeping the rest of the POM. BTW how does this actually work - will the POM include the required <dependencies>? It, ideally, should, right?
replies.author: vorburger

replies.bodyText:
Yeah, the developer section didn't make too much sense to me neither. People can see this - if they are interested - here on Github a lot better.
As for the dependencies: yes, this is done automatically by the "maven" Gradle plugin. You get proper pom.xml with dependencies per module.
replies.author: vidakovic
